content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: ACTARMCD
      operator: non_empty
    - name: USUBJID
      operator: is_not_contained_by
      value: $ds_usubjid
Operations:
  - operator: distinct
    domain: DS
    name: USUBJID
    id: $ds_usubjid
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0540
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: When ACTARMCD is populated, disposition data for subject must be present
Outcome:
  Message: There are no DS records for subject who was assigned treatment
  Output Variables:
    - USUBJID
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0540
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The Disposition dataset provides an accounting for
                  all subjects who entered the study and may include protocol milestones,
                  such as randomization, as well as the subject's completion status
                  or reason for discontinuation for the entire study or each phase
                  or segment of the study, including screening and post-treatment
                  follow-up.
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: Assumption 1
                Section: 6.2.3
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - SPECIAL-PURPOSE
  Domains:
    Include:
      - DM

json.Description: When ACTARMCD is populated, disposition data for subject must be present

Outcome.Message: There are no DS records for subject who was assigned treatment

Citations.Cited_Guidance: The Disposition dataset provides an accounting for all subjects who entered the study and may include protocol milestones, such as randomization, as well as the subject's completion status or reason for discontinuation for the entire study or each phase or segment of the study, including screening and post-treatment follow-up.
